sections.name: Voricose
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Lawful
traits.text: Lawful effects often manipulate energy from law-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to chaotic divine servants or divine servants of chaotic deities. A creature with this trait is lawful in alignment.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Large
traits.text: *Space:* 10 feet, *Reach (Tall):* 10 feet, *Reach (Long):* 5 feet

traits.name: Fiend
traits.text: Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the unholy planes are called fiends. Fiends can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere.

traits.name: Velstrac
traits.text: A family of fiends from the Shadow Plane that are associated with pain and agony. All velstracs possess some form of disturbing gaze.

interaction_abilities.name: Painsight

traits.name: Divination
traits.text: The divination school of magic typically involves obtaining or transferring information, or predicting events.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

interaction_abilities.text: A velstrac automatically knows whether a creature it sees has any of the doomed, dying, and wounded conditions, as well as the value of those conditions.

modifiers.name: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

universal_monster_ability.name: Regeneration
universal_monster_ability.text: This monster regains the listed number of Hit Points each round at the beginning of its turn. Its dying condition never increases beyond dying 3 as long as its regeneration is active. However, if it takes damage of a type listed in the regeneration entry, its regeneration deactivates until the end of its next turn. Deactivate the regeneration before applying any damage of a listed type, since that damage might kill the monster by bringing it to dying 4.

universal_monster_ability.name: Attack of Opportunity
universal_monster_ability.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.
universal_monster_ability.effect: The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

automatic_abilities.name: Glimpse of Stolen Flesh

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Enchantment
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the enchantment school of magic, typically involving mind control, emotion alteration, and other mental effects.

traits.name: Fear
traits.text: Fear effects evoke the emotion of fear. Effects with this trait always have the mental and emotion traits as well.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

traits.name: Visual
traits.text: A visual effect can affect only creatures that can see it. This applies only to visible parts of the effect, as determined by the GM.

automatic_abilities.text: When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it sees pieces of its own body amid the interlocutor's form. The creature must succeed at a DC 33 Will save or become stunned 1.

traits.name: Disarm
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Disarm with the Athletics skill even if you don’t have a free hand. This uses the weapon’s reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls (if any) as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Disarm using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure. On a critical success, you still need a free hand if you want to take the item.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still calculate damage using Strength.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Nonlethal
traits.text: Attacks with this weapon are nonlethal (page 407), and are used to knock creatures unconscious instead of kill them. You can use a nonlethal weapon to make a lethal attack with a –2 circumstance penalty.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: This weapon can be used to attack enemies up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent enemies. For creatures with reach, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

traits.name: Trip
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Trip with the Athletics skill even if you don’t have a free hand. This uses the weapon’s reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Trip using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure.

traits.name: Deadly
traits.text: On a critical hit, the weapon adds a weapon damage die of the listed size. Roll this after doubling the weapon’s damage. This increases to two dice if the weapon has a _greater striking rune_ and three dice if the weapon has a _major striking rune_. For instance, a rapier with a _greater striking rune_ deals 2d8 extra piercing damage on a critical hit. An ability that changes the size of the weapon’s normal damage dice doesn’t change the size of its deadly die.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: This weapon can be used to attack enemies up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent enemies. For creatures with reach, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

ability.name: Focus Gaze

traits.name: Concentrate
traits.text: An action with this trait requires a degree of mental concentration and discipline.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Enchantment
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the enchantment school of magic, typically involving mind control, emotion alteration, and other mental effects.

traits.name: Fear
traits.text: Fear effects evoke the emotion of fear. Effects with this trait always have the mental and emotion traits as well.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

traits.name: Visual
traits.text: A visual effect can affect only creatures that can see it. This applies only to visible parts of the effect, as determined by the GM.

ability.text: The interlocutor stares at a creature they can see within 30 feet. The creature must immediately attempt a Will save against Glimpse of Stolen Flesh. In addition, if the creature was already stunned, on a failed save, it feels its internal organs twist and writhe, and is clumsy 2 for 1 minute. After attempting this save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of the interlocutor's next turn.

ability.name: Surgical Rend
ability.text: This functions as the Rend ability, dealing claw damage. In addition, if the target is a living creature with organs and muscle, the interlocutor opens a precise wound. Until the creature is restored to its maximum Hit Points, thus closing the wound, Strikes against the creature deal 1d6 extra precision damage.
